intro: Corydalis tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal and lance-shaped, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Corydalis tibetica is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its traditional uses in herbal medicine.
